labelLink.label: General Information [Abstract]
General information about the auditee and auditor.
Fiscal Period [Abstract]
Information about the fiscal period of the audit.
Fiscal Period Start Date
First date of the fiscal period covered by the audit.
Fiscal Period End Date
Last date of the fiscal period covered by the audit.
Type of Audit [Abstract]
Information about the type of Uniform Guidance Audit.
Uniform Audit Guidance Type

Indicate if the Uniform Guidance Audit is Single Audit or Program-specific Audit. 2 CFR 200.501 of the Uniform Guidance requires non-Federal entities that expend $750,000 or more in a year in Federal awards to have a single audit conducted, except when they elect to have a program-specific audit conducted in accordance with 2 CFR 200.507.
Audit Period [Abstract]
Information about the period covered by the audit.
Audit Period Covered

Report as Annual, Biennial, or Other. Annual audits cover 12 months and biennial audits cover 24 months. If the audit period covered is neither annual nor biennial, report as "Other" and indicate the number of months by using the element AuditPeriodCoveredMonths.
GRM Legal Entity Audit Period Covered Quantity
Number of months covered in the audit. To be used only if audit is other than annual or biennial.
Information about identification numbers for the grantee.
The Tax Identification Number (TIN), also known as an Employer Identification Number (EIN), for the grantee. This is a unique 9-digit value assigned by the IRS.
Multiple Employer Tax Identifications

Indicates if the auditee (or components of an auditee covered by the audit) was assigned more than one EIN by the IRS. For example, a statewide audit covers many departments, each of which may have its own EIN). If there is more than one EIN, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. If there is more than one EIN number, use the Auditee EIN Continuation List [Table] to collect information about additional EIN numbers.
The organization's DUNS or DUNS+4 number received from Dun and Bradstreet. Information on obtaining a DUNS number may be obtained by visiting www.grants.gov.
Multiple DUNS Numbers

Indicates if the auditee (or components of an auditee covered by the audit) was assigned more than one DUNS number. If there is more than one DUNS, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. If there is more than one DUNS number, use the Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Table] to collect information about additional DUNS numbers.
Information about the grantee.
Name of the Grantee associated with the primary EIN. When possible, this name should match to the name assigned to the primary EIN by the IRS.
Street address of the Grantee, line 1.
City of the Grantee address.
State of the Grantee address.
Zip code of the Grantee address.
Grantee Contact First Name.
Grantee Contact Title.
Grantee Contact Phone.
Grantee Contact Email.
Primary Auditor Information [Abstract]
Information about the primary auditor.
Primary Auditor Name
Name of the primary auditor associated with the primary EIN. When possible, this name should match to the name assigned to the primary EIN by the IRS.
Primary Auditor Address Street Address
Street address of the primary auditor.
Primary Auditor Address City
City of the primary auditor street address.
Primary Auditor Address State
State of the primary auditor street address.
Primary Auditor Address Zip Code
Zip code of the primary auditor street address.
Primary Auditor Contact Name
Primary auditor contact name.
Primary Auditor Contact Title
Primary auditor contact title.
Primary Auditor Contact Phone
Primary auditor contact phone.
Primary Auditor Contact Email
Primary auditor contact email.
Secondary Auditor Used
Indicates whether multiple auditors contributed to the audit. If there is, report value of TRUE; if there is not, FALSE.
Secondary Auditor Information [Abstract]
Information about the Secondary auditor.
Secondary Auditor Name
Name of the secondary auditor associated with the secondary EIN. When possible, this name should match to the name assigned to the secondary EIN by the IRS.
Secondary Auditor Address Street Address
Street address of the secondary auditor.
Secondary Auditor Address City
City of the secondary auditor street address.
Secondary Auditor Address State
State of the secondary auditor street address.
Secondary Auditor Address Zip Code
Zip code of the secondary auditor street address.
Secondary Auditor Contact Name
Secondary auditor contact name.
Secondary Auditor Contact Title
Secondary auditor contact title.
Secondary Auditor Contact Phone
Secondary auditor contact phone.
Secondary Auditor Contact Email
Secondary auditor contact email.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Abstract]
Information about additional auditee DUNS numbers.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Table]
Table used to capture information about Auditee DUNS Continuation Lists.

Used to identify multiple DUNS numbers for additional auditees. If the value TRUE was reported for the concept MultipleDUNSNumbers, use this axis which is a typed dimension along with the concept AuditeeDUNSNumber. Report a DUNS number using this table if it identities a component entity (e.g., State Agency, sub-entity) of the auditee with Federal awards expended during the fiscal period included in the audit. Do not include separate DUNS numbers for any component entity that did not expend or otherwise administer Federal awards.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Line Items]
Used to collect information about Auditee DUNS Continuation Lists.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Abstract]
Information about additional auditee EIN numbers.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Table]
Table used to capture information about Auditee EIN Continuation Lists.

Used to identify multiple EIN numbers for additional auditees. If the value TRUE was reported for the concept MultipleEmployeeTaxIdentification, use this axis which is a typed dimension along with the concept AuditeeEmployerIdentificationNumber. Report an EIN number using this table if it identities a component entity (e.g., State Agency, sub-entity) of the auditee with Federal awards expended during the fiscal period included in the audit. Do not include separate EIN numbers for any component entity that did not expend or otherwise administer Federal awards.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Line Items]
Used to collect information about Auditee EIN Continuation Lists.
Schedule of Federal Awards and Questioned Costs [Abstract]
Information about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards in the Single Audit package.
Schedule of Federal Awards and Questioned Costs [Table]
Table used to capture information about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards in the Single Audit package.
Federal Program Identifier [Axis]
Used to identify a federal program as shown in the CFDA. Use to represent information about a Federal Program, such as Federal Program Name, Federal Expenditures, or CFDA Number.
Schedule of Federal Awards and Questioned Costs [Line Items]

Used to collect information on the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards. To associate a line item concept with a specific cluster and federal awarding agency, use with a context including the FederalAwardingAgencyEnumerated and ClusterNameEnumerated elements.
Federal Awarding Agency [Enumerated]

Name of the Federal Awarding Agency, select from an enumerated list of existing Federal Awarding Agencies. Use in the context along with the concept ClusterNameEnumerated to define a cluster/agency combination that can be associated with line items about a specific federal program, such as Federal Program Name or CFDA number.
CFDA Number

The CFDA number is a two-digit prefix representing the Federal Awarding agency and a three digit extension separated by a period. The last three digits of the CFDA number represent the program which should be listed in the CFDA catalog. If the program is unknown, enter a "U" followed by a two-digit number in the CFDA extension to identify one or more Federal award lines that form the program. For example, the first Federal program with an unknown three-digit extension would be U01 for all award lines associated with that program, the second would be U02, and so on. If the program is part of the Research and Development cluster and the three-digit CFDA extension is unknown, enter "RD" as the three-digit extension.
Additional Award Identification

Information that can be used to identify the award, which is not a CFDA number, for example, program year, contract number, state issued numbers, etc. If the CFDA Three-Digit Extension is unknown, this is a required field.
Amount Expended
Amount of expenditures for the Federal award which represents the total of direct funds and indirect funds (Pass Through Amount), if any, which are passed through to subrecipients.
GRM Legal Entity Cluster Name

Name of the cluster, select from an enumerated list of existing cluster names. Should be used in the context along with the concept FederalAwardingAgencyEnumerated to define a cluster/agency combination that can be associated with line items about a specific federal program, such as Federal Program Name or CFDA number. If a state cluster is used, use the StateClusterName element. If the cluster is not on this enumerated list, use the OtherClusterName element.
Additional Cluster Information [Abstract]
Information about the program cluster when it is a state cluster or is not already listed.
State Cluster Name
Name of the State Cluster. Used if State Cluster was selected from ClusterNameEnumerated.
Other Cluster Name
Name of the cluster, if the cluster is not available in the concept ClusterNameEnumerated.
Loan Program [Abstract]
Information about Federal Awards that are part of a Loan Program.
Federal Loan or Loan Guarantee
Indicates whether the program is a Federal loan or a Federal loan guarantee. If it is, report as TRUE; if it is not, report as FALSE.
Outstanding Loan Balance, End of Audit Period
The amount of the loan or loan guarantee balance outstanding at the end of the audit period for loan programs as identified in Part I, Item 1(i), as required by 2 CFR 200.510(b)(5).
Federal Award Source Information [Abstract]
Information about the source of the Federal Award which can be direct funds or funds that are passed through to sub-recipients.
Direct Award

Indicates if the award was received directly from a Federal awarding agency. If funds were received directly, report as TRUE; if funds were received as a pass-through, report as FALSE. When an award consists of both direct and indirect funds, use the element AmountExpendedDirect, and AmountExpendedIndirect to represent the amounts. If an award is received directly, but then transferred to another part of the same single audit reporting entity, these awards should still be reported as direct (transfers within the single audit reporting entity do not create a pass-through entity/subrecipient relationship).
Pass-through Source Entity Name
Name of the pass-through entity for award amounts identified as not being direct, as required 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2).
Pass-through Source Entity Identifier

Identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity, for award lines identified as not being direct. The identifying number is required by 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2). If there is not an identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity, report this element as "N/A".
Award Passed Through to Subrecipients
Indicates if the award was passed through to subrecipients. If awards were passed through, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Pass Through Amount
If an award was passed through to any subrecipients, the total amount provided to subrecipients for each Federal program is required (2 CFR 200.510(b)(4)).
Major Program and Audit Findings [Abstract]
Information about major programs and audit findings.
Major Program
Indicates if the Federal program is a major program as defined in 2 CFR 200.518. If it is a major program, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Type of Single Audit Opinion

Indicates the type of opinion for a Single Audit Report for a Major Program. Can be reported as Unmodified opinion (U), Qualified opinion (Q), Adverse opinion (A), or Disclaimer of opinion (D). For clusters of programs, the type of audit report must apply to the cluster as a whole, and should be reported for all programs in a cluster. If the program is not a Major Program, do not use this element.
GRM Legal Entity Audit Findings Total Quantity
A value indicating the total count of grant recipient audit findings on the Federal program as a result of the current audit. (221, augmented)
Audit Finding Reference Number
Audit findings reference number. The required format is the four-digit year, a hyphen and a three-digit number (e.g., 2019-001, 2019-002).
Audit Finding [Abstract]
Information about audit findings.
Audit Finding [Table]
Table used to capture information about audit findings.
Used to identify an audit finding associated with a federal program.
Audit Finding [Line Items]
Used to collect information about audit findings on the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.
Federal Program Identifier [Enumerated]

Enumerated list of program identifiers which corresponds to the FederalProgramIdentifierAxis. Use this concept with the AuditFindingIdentifierTable to link the audit finding to a Federal Program. Use this concept when with the FederalSubprogramIdentifierTable to link a subprogram to a primary Federal program.
Type(s) of Compliance Requirement [Abstract]
Information about the type of compliance the auditor was testing which generated the audit finding.
Compliance Requirement, Activities Allowed or Unallowed
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "activities allowed or unallowed". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Allowable Costs and Cost Principles
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "allowable costs and cost principles". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Cash Management
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "cash management". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Eligibility
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "eligibility". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Equipment and Real Property Management

Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "equipment and real property management". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Matching, Level of Effort, Earmarking
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "matching, level of effort, earmarking". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Period of Performance of Federal Funds

Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "period of performance (or availability) of Federal funds". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Procurement, Suspension, Disbarment

Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "procurement and suspension and disbarment". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Program Income
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "program income". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Reporting
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "reporting". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Reserved
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "reserved". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Subrecipient Monitoring
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "subrecipient monitoring". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Special Tests and Provisions
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "special tests and provisions". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Other

Indicates the type of compliance requirement being tested which generated the audit finding was not specified in Part 3 of the Compliance Supplement, and is therefore designated as "other". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Type of Audit Finding [Abstract]
Information about the type of audit findings.
Compliance Audit Findings [Abstract]
Information about compliance audit findings.
Compliance Audit Modified Opinion

Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding on the Report on Compliance for Each Major Federal Program as the basis for a Modified Opinion. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if the auditor did not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Audit Other Matters

Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding on the Report on Compliance for Each Major Federal Program as the basis for Other Matters. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if the auditor did not, report as FALSE.
Internal Control Audit Findings [Abstract]
Information about internal control audit findings.
Internal Control Audit Material Weakness
Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding in the Report on Internal Control over Compliance as a Material Weakness. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Internal Control Audit Significant Deficiency
Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding in the Report on Internal Control over Compliance as a Significant Deficiency. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Other Audit Findings
Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding as not classified under the Report on Compliance or the Report on Internal Controls. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Questioned Costs
Indicates if there were any questioned costs related to the audit finding, even if the amount cannot be determined. If there were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Repeat Finding From Prior Year
Indicates whether the audit finding is a repeat of an audit finding from the immediate prior year. If it is, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Repeat Finding Audit Reference Number
Prior year audit reference number(s) from the immediate prior audit (2 CFR 200.516(b)(8) for repeat findings identified.
Audit Finding Text
Text of the audit finding that directly corresponds to the audit finding reference number.
GRM Legal Entity Audit Corrective Action Text
A description of the planned action to be taken by the grant recipient to address audit finding. (190, augmented)

Federal Awarding Agency Totals [Line Items]

Federal Subprogram Identifier [Abstract]
Information about federal programs that have separate subprograms.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Table]
Used to collect information about subprograms.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Axis]
Use this axis to represent federal award subprograms which are linked to a federal award program.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Line Items]
Used to represent information about federal programs that are split into subprograms which may have separate contract numbers.
Notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards [Abstract]
Information about notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA).
Significant Accounting Policy
Description of the significant accounting policies used in preparing the SEFA (2CFR 200.510(b)(6)).
Auditee Used De Minimis Cost Rate
Indicates if the auditee elected to use the de minimus cost rate. May be reported as Yes, No, or Both.
Title of an additional note 2 in the notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards.
Additional note 2 provided about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA), as needed.
Information About Findings and Questioned Costs [Abstract]
Information about findings and questioned costs.
Financial Statements [Abstract]
Information about the Financial Statements.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements [Abstract]
Information about the auditor's opinion of the financial statements.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Adverse

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Adverse opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Disclaimer

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Disclaimer of opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Not US GAAP

The results of the auditor's determination is that the financial statements were not prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), but were instead prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework as defined in AU-C 800 "Special Considerations - Audits of Financial Statements Prepared in Accordance with Special Purpose Framework". If so, select "Adverse opinion" as TRUE, and select this concept as TRUE. If not, report this concept as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Qualified

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Qualified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Unmodified

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Unmodified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Special Purpose Framework [Abstract]
Information about the financial statements that were prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework.
Special Purpose Framework Type
Indicates the type of Special Purpose Framework which may be Cash basis, Tax basis, Regulatory basis, Contractual basis, or Other basis.
Special Purpose Framework Required by Law

Indicates if the Special Purpose Framework used as a basis of accounting required by state law. Report as TRUE if required, report as FALSE if it was permitted by state law but not required. This will affect whether the entity can qualify as a low-risk auditee in the two subsequent audit periods (2 CFR 200.520(b)).
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Unmodified
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was unmodified.
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Qualified
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was qualified.
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Adverse
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was adverse.
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Disclaimer
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was disclaimer of opinion.
Going Concern Financial Stress Paragraph in Opinion
Indicates if a "going concern" emphasis-of-matter paragraph is included in the auditor's report.
Indicates if a significant deficiency in internal controls in the financial statements was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Indicates if a material weakness in internal controls in the financial statements was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Indicates if material noncompliance was disclosed in the financial statements. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Information about the Federal Awards and Major Programs in the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.

Indicates if the auditor's report includes a statement that the auditee's financial statements include departments, agencies, or other governmental units expending $750,000 or more in Federal awards that have separate Uniform Guidance audits which are not included in this audit, per the AICPA Audit Guide. If it does, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Grant Award Program Type A Type B Threshold Amount
A dollar amount threshold used to distinguish between Type A and Type B programs, when a recalculation of the Type A threshold is required for large loan or loan guarantees. (221)
GRM Legal Entity Low Risk Indicator
An indicator denoting the grant recipient qualifies as low-risk at the beginning of the audit period. (221)
GRM Legal Entity Audit Prior Audit Findings Indicator
An indicator denoting a grant recipient audit findings exist relating to direct Federal awards expended by Federal agency(ies) on the Summary Schedule of Prior Audit Findings report. (221, augmented)
labelLink.link:label: Program or Award Amount
Amount of the program or Federal award.
Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards [Abstract]
Information about the Schedule of Federal Awards.
Federal Program Name CFDA Title
CFDA, Amounts and Cluster Information [Abstract]

Used to collect information about amounts awarded, expended, and passed through for CFDA numbers.
Used as an identifier for the CFDA number.
Direct Amount Expended

Amount of expenditures for the Federal award which represents direct funds expended only. Use this concept if a portion of funds for the federal program are passed through to sub-recipients. If none of the funds are passed through to sub-recipients, use the concept Amount Expended.
labelLink.label: Additional Note 2
Title of Additional Note to the SEFA 2
labelLink.link:label: Title of Additional Note to the SEFA 3

Additional Note 3
Additional note 3 provided about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA), as needed.
Additional Note 4
Additional note 4 provided about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA), as needed.
Title of Additional Note to the SEFA 4
Title of an additional note 2 in the notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards.
Other Financial Statement Auditors Results [Abstract]

Other Federal Awards Auditors Results [Abstract]

labelLink.link:label: Internal Control Significant Deficiency Federal Awards Disclosed
Indicates if a significant deficiency in internal controls of federal awards was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Internal Control Material Weakness Federal Awards Disclosed
Indicates if a material weakness in internal controls of federal awards was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
labelLink.label: Material Noncompliance Disclosed Financial Statements
labelLink.link:label: Federal Agency Prior Audit Findings
Listing of two digit codes indicating the Federal Agency(ies) that have prior audit findings shown in the Summary Schedule of Prior Audit Findings related to direct funding.
Findings and Questioned Costs Related to Federal Awards
Findings Related to Financial Statements in Accordance with Government Auditing Standards
Summary Schedule Prior Audit Findings Required Reported
labelLink.label: Audit Findings Required Disclosed in Accordance with Uniform Guidance
labelLink.link:label: Indicates if audit findings related to financial statements are in accordance with government auditing standards. If they are, report as TRUE; if they are not, report as FALSE.
An indicator if there are findings and questioned costs related to federal awards. If there are findings and questioned costs, report as TRUE; if there are not, report as FALSE.
An indicator if a summary schedule of prior audit findings is required to be reported. If there is, report as TRUE; if there is not, report as FALSE.
Grants Management - Application for Federal Assistance [Abstract]
Application for Federal Assistance [Line Items]
Grant Application Submission Type Code
A code denoting the type of submission that is being submitted, such as initial application for an award, pre-application or revised application for an award.
Grant Type of Application

A code denoting the type of application which may be New (an application that is being submitted to an agency for the first time), Continuation (an extension for an additional funding/budget period for a project with a projected completion date. This can include renewals), or Revision (any change in the federal government's financial obligation or contingent liability from an existing obligation. If a revision, use the concept GrantApplicationTypeOfRevision and enter the appropriate revision type.
Grant Application Type of Revision
Grant Application Other Revision Description

Grants Management Project Information [Abstract]

Amount requested or to be contributed during the first funding/budget period by the federal government. Value of in-kind contributions should be included on appropriate lines, as applicable. If the action will result in a dollar change to an existing award, indicate only the amount of the change. For decreases, report as negative values.

Amount requested or to be contributed during the first funding/budget period by the applicant. Value of in-kind contributions should be included on appropriate lines, as applicable. If the action will result in a dollar change to an existing award, indicate only the amount of the change. For decreases, report as negative values.

Amount requested or to be contributed during the first funding/budget period by the state. Value of in-kind contributions should be included on appropriate lines, as applicable. If the action will result in a dollar change to an existing award, indicate only the amount of the change. For decreases, report as negative values.

Amount requested or to be contributed during the first funding/budget period by the local government. Value of in-kind contributions should be included on appropriate lines, as applicable. If the action will result in a dollar change to an existing award, indicate only the amount of the change. For decreases, report as negative values.

Amount requested or to be contributed during the first funding/budget period by an other party not otherwise specified. Value of in-kind contributions should be included on appropriate lines, as applicable. If the action will result in a dollar change to an existing award, indicate only the amount of the change. For decreases, report as negative values.
Estimated Funding

Total amount requested or to be contributed during the first funding/budget period. Value of in-kind contributions should be included on appropriate lines, as applicable. If the action will result in a dollar change to an existing award, indicate only the amount of the change. For decreases, report as negative values.
Application Subject to Executive Order 12372

Applicants should contact the State Single Point of Contact (SPOC) for Federal Executive Order 12372 to determine whether the application is subject to the State intergovernmental review process and make the appropriate selection. If the application has been made available to the State for review, also report the date the application was submitted to the State.
State 12372 Review Date
Date the application was made available to the State for review under the Executive Order 12372 Process.
Applicant is Delinquent on Any Federal Debt

Applies to the applicant organization, not the person who signs as the authorized representative. Categories of federal debt include, but may not be limited to: delinquent audit disallowances, loans and taxes. If yes, include an explanation attachment.

Grants Management Federal Financial Report [Abstract]
Information about the Grants Management Federal Financial Report SF 425.
Organizational Unit Division Name
Grants Management Grant Information [Abstract]
Grants Management Report Information [Abstract]
Federal Financial Report Type
Type of Federal Financial Report being submitted, which can be Quarterly, Semi-Annual, Annual, or Final.
Federal Financial Report Basis of Accounting

Specify whether a cash or accrual basis was used for recording transactions related to the award(s) and for preparing the FFR. Accrual basis of accounting refers to the accounting method in which expenses are recorded when incurred. For cash basis accounting, expenses are recorded when they are paid.
Project or Grant Start Period

Indicate the period in the award document during which Federal sponsorship starts. Note: Some agencies award multi-year grants for a project period that is funded in increments or budget periods (typically annual increments). Throughout the project period, agencies often require cumulative reporting for consecutive budget periods. Under these circumstances, enter the start of the project period not the budget period. Do not use this concept if reporting on multiple awards.
Project or Grant Ending Period

Indicate the period in the award document during which Federal sponsorship ends. Note: Some agencies award multi-year grants for a project period that is funded in increments or budget periods (typically annual increments). Throughout the project period, agencies often require cumulative reporting for consecutive budget periods. Under these circumstances, enter the ending of the project period not the budget period. Do not use this concept if reporting on multiple awards.
Reporting Period End

Indicate the ending date of the reporting period. For quarterly, semi-annual, and annual interim reports, use the following reporting period end dates: 3/31, 6/30, 9/30, or 12/31. For final FFRs, the reporting period end date shall be the end date of the project or grant period.
Grants Management Transactions [Abstract]
Federal Cash [Abstract]
Federal Expenditures and Unobligated Balance [Abstract]
Recipient Share [Abstract]
Program Income [Abstract]
Grants Management Federal Financial Report [Table]
Federal Financial Report [Line Items]
Federal Cash, Cash Receipts
Cumulative amount of actual cash received from the Federal agency as of the reporting period end date.
Federal Cash, Cash On Hand

Report the amount of Cash Receipts minus Cash Disbursements. Represents immediate cash needs. If more than three business days of cash are on hand, the Federal agency may require an explanation which can be entered using the Remarks concept explaining why the drawdown was made prematurely or other reasons for the excess cash.
Federal Cash, Cash Disbursements

Cumulative amount of Federal fund disbursements (such as cash or checks) as of the reporting period end date. Disbursements are the sum of actual cash disbursements for direct charges for goods and services, the amount of indirect expenses charged to the award, and the amount of cash advances and payments made to subrecipients and contractors. For multiple grants report each grant separately on the FFR attachment. The sum of the cumulative cash disbursements on the FFR attachment must equal the amount reported for this concept.
Information about Federal Expenditures and Unobligated Balance. Do not use these concepts if reporting on multiple awards.
Federal Expenditures, Federal Funds Authorized
Total Federal funds authorized as of the reporting period end date.
Federal Expenditures, Federal Share of Unliquidated Obligations
Federal Expenditures, Federal Share
Sum of Federal Share of Expenditures and Federal Share of Unliquidated Obligations.
Unobligated Balance of Federal Funds
Federal Funds Authorized minus total Federal Share.
Information about the recipient share. Do not use these concepts if reporting on multiple awards.
Recipient Share Required
Recipient Share of Expenditures

Recipient share of actual cash disbursements or outlays (less any rebates, refunds, or other credits) including payments to subrecipients and contractors. This amount may include the value of allowable third party in-kind contributions and recipient share of program income used to finance the non-Federal share of the project or program. Note: On the final report this should be equal to or greater than the amount of Total Recipient Share Required.
Remaining Recipient Share to be Provided
Amount of Recipient Share Required minus Recipient Share of Expenditures. If recipient share is greater than the required match, enter zero.
Information about program income.
Total Federal Program Income Earned
Program Income Expended in Accordance With the Deduction Alternative
Amount of program income that was used to reduce the Federal share of the total project costs.
Program Income Expended in Accordance With the Addition Alternative
Unexpended Program Income

Used to collect information about indirect expenses. Provide this information only if required by the awarding agency. Enter cumulative amounts from date of the inception of the award through the end date of the reporting period.
Indirect Cost Rate
Indirect cost rate in effect for the reporting period.
Beginning Effective Date for Indirect Cost Rate
Beginning effective date for the indirect cost rate.
Ending Effective Date for Indirect Cost Rate
Ending effective date for the indirect cost rate.
Base Amount
Base amount against which the indirect cost rate is applied.
Indirect Cost, Amount Charged
Amount of indirect cost charged during the time period specified.
Federal Share of Indirect Cost, Amount Charged
Federal share of indirect cost charged during the time period specified.

Certification Agreement

Certification agreement flag. If TRUE, applicant agrees to the following by signing this application: I certify (1) to the statements contained in the list of certifications and assurances contained in the announcement or agency specific instructions and (2) that the statements herein are true, complete and accurate to the best of my knowledge. I also provide the required assurances and agree to comply with any resulting terms if I accept an award. I am aware that any false, fictitious, or fraudulent statements or claims may subject me to criminal, civil, or administrative penalties. (U.S. Code, Title 218, Section 1001).

The auditors report issued on compliance for major programs was "Adverse Opinion". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
The auditors report issued on compliance for major programs was "Disclaimer". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

Enter the applicant's congressional district. Enter in the format: 2 characters state abbreviation - 3 characters district number, e.g., CA-005 for California 5th district, CA-12 for California 12th district, NC-103 for North Carolina's 103rd district. If all congressional districts in a state are affected, enter "all" for the district number, e.g., MD-all for all congressional districts in Maryland. If nationwide, i.e., all districts within all states are affected, enter US-all. If the program/project is outside the US, enter 00-000. This optional data element is intended for use only by programs for which the area(s) affected are likely to be different than place(s) of performance reported on the SF-424 Project/Performance Site Location(s) Form.

Enter the congressional district of the program or project. Enter in the format: 2 characters state abbreviation - 3 characters district number, e.g., CA-005 for California 5th district, CA-12 for California 12th district, NC-103 for North Carolina's 103rd district. If all congressional districts in a state are affected, enter "all" for the district number, e.g., MD-all for all congressional districts in Maryland. If nationwide, i.e., all districts within all states are affected, enter US-all. If the program/project is outside the US, enter 00-000. This optional data element is intended for use only by programs for which the area(s) affected are likely to be different than place(s) of performance reported on the SF-424 Project/Performance Site Location(s) Form.
Date the FFR is submitted to the Federal agency.

For new applications, do not report Estimated Unobligated Federal Funds. For continuing grant applications, submit the Budget Summary before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency, and report estimated unobligated amounts which will remain unobligated at the end of the grant funding period only if the federal grantor agency instructions provide for this. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, do not report unobligated fund amounts.

For new applications, do not report Estimated Unobligated Non-Federal Funds. For continuing grant applications, submit the Budget Summary before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency, and report estimated unobligated amounts which will remain unobligated at the end of the grant funding period only if the federal grantor agency instructions provide for this. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, do not report unobligated fund amounts.

Name of the Federal program as shown in the CFDA. If the program is not listed in the CFDA, a description of the award recognizable by the Federal awarding agency or pass-through entity should be entered.
Funds required for construction from the selected program, if applicable.
Funds required for contractual costs from the selected program, if applicable.
Funds required for direct and indirect charges, if applicable.
Funds required for total direct costs from the selected program.
Funds required for equipment from the selected program, if applicable.
Indirect cost of the selected program, if applicable.
Funds required for other costs from the selected program, if applicable.
Funds required for supplies from the selected program, if applicable.
Funds required for travel from the selected program, if applicable.
Internal Control Material Weakness Disclosed Financial Statements
Internal Control Significant Deficiency Disclosed Financial Statements

For new applications, report the total amount of funds needed to support the project for the first funding period (usually a year), which should be the sum of New or Revised Budget, Federal and Non Federal. For continuing grant program applications, the amount reported should be the sum of the New or Revised Budget, Federal and Non Federal. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, report the new total budgeted amount plus or minus the increase/decrease in New or Revised Budget, Federal and Non Federal, as appropriate.

For new applications, report the amount of Federal funds needed to support the project for the first funding period (usually a year). For continuing grant program applications, submit these forms before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency and report the amount of funds needed for the upcoming period. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, report the amount of the increase or decrease of federal funds.

For new applications, report the amount of Non-Federal funds needed to support the project for the first funding period (usually a year). For continuing grant program applications, submit these forms before the end of each funding period as required by the grantor agency and report the amount of funds needed for the upcoming period. For supplemental grants and changes to existing grants, report the amount of the increase or decrease of non-federal funds.
Used to identify non federal source contributions types.
Used to identify non federal source contributions types.
Amount of program income that was added to funds committed to the total project costs and expended to further eligible project or program activities.
Information about questioned costs and repeat audit findings.

Total required recipient share for reporting period specified in this report as Reporting Period End. The required recipient should include all matching and cost sharing provided by recipients and third-party providers to meet the level required by the Federal agency. This amount should not include cost sharing and match amounts in excess of the amount required by the Federal agency (for example, cost overruns for which the recipient incurs additional expenses and, therefore, contributes a greater level of cost sharing or match than the level required by the Federal agency).
Amount of Federal program income earned. Do not report any program income that is being allocated as part of the recipient's cost share amount included in Recipient Share of Expenditures.

Amount of Total Federal Program Income Earned minus Program Income Expended in Accordance with the Deduction Alternative or the Addition Alternative. This amount equals the program income that has been earned but not expended, as of the reporting period end date.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Axis]
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Axis]

If the type of application is a revision, indicate what type of revision, which can be A. Increase Award, B. Decrease Award, C. Increase Duration, D. Decrease Duration, or E. Other (specify). If the revision is Other, use the concept OtherRevisionType to specify the revision type.

Unliquidated obligations on a cash basis are obligations incurred, but not yet paid. On an accrual basis, unliquidated obligations are obligations incurred, but for which an expenditure has not yet been recorded. Enter the Federal portion of unliquidated obligations. Those obligations included direct and indirect expenses incurred but not yet paid or charged to the award, including amounts due to subrecipients and contractors. On the final report, this reported value should be zero unless the awarding agency has provided other instructions. Do not include any amount that has been included in Federal Share of Expenditures, or any amount for a future commitment of funds (such as a long-term contract) for which an obligation or expense has not been incurred.
